newsitem.title: USA: Two Intel senior vice presidents to resign.
newsitem.headline: Two Intel senior vice presidents to resign.

text.p: Intel Corp said senior vice presidents David House and Carl Everett are leaving the company.

House, senior vice president of Intel's Enterprise Server Group (ESG), is leaving to join Bay Networks Inc as its chief executive officer. Everett, senior vice president and co-general manager of the Desktop Products Group (DPG), will manage the transition of DPG through the end of the year, Intel said.
Intel said House will be replaced by John Miner, who has served as vice president and general manager of Intel's OEM Products and Services Division for the past four years.
It said Patrick Gelsinger, vice president of the Internet and Communications Group, will replace Carl Everett as co-general manager of DPG, along with Mike Aymar, currently an Intel vice president.
Intel said it will recommend that Miner and Gelsinger be elected corporate vice presidents at the next board of directors meeting.

Intel also said that it will merge its Corporate Marketing Group with its Sales Group, to form Corporate Sales and Marketing, which will be co-directed by executive vice president Paul Otellini and vice president Dennis Carter.
